item.title: Jamie Jensen: Road Trip USA! - Jun 07,2012
item.description:
Want to spend your summer vacation dollars where you’ll not only have fun, you’ll also visit some of this country’s most amazing sights and keep costs down? If that sounds like you, be sure to tune in and hear what Jamie Jensen has to say. As a great traveler himself and author of Road Trip USA, Jamie will share America’s top ten quirky attractions, this country’s best diners and drive-ins, his favorite National Parks and camping grounds, and his expert tips for creating a fun and cost effective vacation. So, if you want to start your summer off with a bang, be certain to catch this lively discussion that will make your own road trip a memorable one!

item.title: Shea Vaughn - Jun 01,2012
item.description:
If you’re looking for a meaningful change in your life that brings clarity, health, and vibrant wellbeing, you’ll want to hear what Shea Vaughn has to say. A fitness expert, professional trainer, and wellness coach (also actor Vince Vaughn’s mom), Shea has created a revolutionary lifestyle practice she calls SheaNetics. SheaNetics combines the values of both Eastern and Western wellness practices to unite the mind, body, spirit, and heart as one. Shea will also explain the 5 living principles to total wellbeing that are found in her book, Breakthrough. So if you want to live a more balanced, authentic and enriched life, you’ll want to be sure to tune in to this one!

item.title: Senator Adlai E. Stevenson III - May 23,2012
item.description:
Senator Adlai Stevenson III is returning to share stories from his insightful, wide-ranging, and wonderfully humorous work, The Black Book. This captivating read is a treasure trove of historical references, anecdotes, sayings, and laugh-out-loud quotes compiled by several generations of the senator’s remarkable family. Be certain to join us as Senator Stevenson gives us his thoughts on the current political realities of our country, how the tactics of Washington today differ from times past, and some ways we might all learn from the wisdom to be found in The Black Book. This is 15-minutes you won’t want to miss!

item.title: Tara Allmen, M.D. - May 18,2012
item.description:
Anyone who is experiencing menopausal symptoms knows that this particular passage can prove a frustrating and uncomfortable time in a woman’s life. Dr. Tara Allmen, National Certified Menopause Practitioner, Board Certified Obstetrician and Gynecologist, and nationally known expert in the field, will be joining us to cut through the confusion. She’ll be giving us the clear, concise information we need to know to make important decisions regarding our health and well-being. So if you want to make your own informed choices about menopause and its symptoms, you won’t want to miss Dr. Allmen’s valuable message!

item.title: Barbara Hannah Grufferman - May 04,2012
item.description:
Barbara Hannah Grufferman is on a mission to keep us feeling healthy, fit, stylish, and happy as we age. You know her from her various media appearances, her column on Huffington Post at Huff/Post 50, and as the author of the definitive guide to life after 50, The Best of Everything After 50: The expert’s Guide to Style, Sex, Health, Money, and More. Barbara will be joining us to share her “50% Solution” a doable action plan that can make a huge difference in your own life. So be sure to tune in… you won’t want to miss this one!

item.title: Les Hewitt - Apr 30,2012
item.description:
Do you know the #1 reason that stops people from getting what they want? If not, you’ll find out here as Les Hewitt, co-author of The Power of Focus with Jack Canfield and Mark Victor Hansen, gives us the secret behind achieving whatever you want in life. He’ll present clear and actionable steps to move you forward, focus on what you do best, and let go of the rest. If you want to feel good about yourself, your future, your relationships, finances, and more, be sure to tune in for this one!

item.title: J. Randy Taraborrelli - Apr 27,2012
item.description:
J. Randy Taraborrelli is one of the premier authors of our time with a whopping 10 bestsellers to his credit. He’s joining us to introduce his latest work—a guaranteed chartbuster entitled After Camelot: A Personal History of the Kennedy Family 1968-Present. The book shares such fascinating revelations as the special pre-nup between Ted Kennedy and Aristotle Onassis for Jackie’s hand; insider information regarding the relationship between Carolyn and John and how it mellowed just before their tragic death; the details of Ted Kennedy’s cancer diagnosis, and much, much more. Be sure to join us for this riveting interview that’s guaranteed to open a window into the family that’s inspired and intrigued the boomer generation for years.

item.title: Audrey Pellicano - Apr 20,2012
item.description:
Are you a widow or know someone who is? If so, you’ll want to be certain to tune in and hear Audrey Pellicano, well-known health counselor who specializes in assisting widows create new roles for themselves and add meaning in their life. Audrey will be giving us her take on redefining your relationships, career, health, and social life so that you can face the world again with confidence. Even if you’re not a widow, you should consider the possibility of becoming one and take steps now. You won’t want to miss her important message!

item.title: Michael Silverstein - Apr 13,2012
item.description:
Have you ever thought about getting published? Do you want to avoid the pitfalls and mistakes made by most new authors? Would you like to learn the easiest and most effective way to get your work out there? If so, this show is for you! Michael Silverstein has been writing and editing for major publications for more than 40 years. His work has appeared in The Wall Street Journal, New York Times, Christian Science Monitor, and several other high profile publications. In fact, Michael has written more than a dozen books that were published by major publishing firms. He’s also been a regular on Public Radio. Michael has just come out with his latest comic novel, Fifteen Feet Beneath Manhattan, but this time he took a different route. Michael chose to self-publish and he’ll be joining us to share his insider tips, his “dos” and “don’ts,” and more about his unique, rather quirky and very funny new book. So, if you’ve ever thought of getting your own words in print, you’ll want to be certain to catch this one!

item.title: Senator Adlai E. Stevenson III - Apr 04,2012
item.description:
The Stevenson family is one of only a handful of families that has played such an integral and indelible role in our country’s political history. Feisty Side of Fifty Radio is honored to welcome Senator Adlai E. Stevenson III to the program to discuss his insightful, wide-ranging, and wonderfully humorous work, The Black Book. In The Black Book, Senator Stevenson has gathered and compiled recollections and remembrances from five generations of his family—from his great, great grandfather (who was instrumental in securing the Presidency for Abraham Lincoln) down through his own career in politics. The book is a treasure trove of historical references, anecdotes, sayings, and laugh-out-loud quotes. It’s also rich with behind-the-scenes politics that will inspire, amuse, and sometimes outrage the reader but will always having you turning pages with anticipation of what’s to come. You’ll want to be sure to tune in to hear Senator Stevenson share this personal and surprisingly tongue-in-cheek tale of American political history from an insider’s point of view. His work is dedicated to drawing “lessons for the future from a rich past.” And this show promises to be an event filled with insight and humor that will be one for your own memory book!

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine: When Friendships Turn Toxic - Mar 27,2012
item.description:
For many of us, our female friendships form the mainstay of our lives. These wonderful women celebrate our triumphs, wipe our tears, and share our secrets. But even the closest of relationships can run into problems. Suzanne Braun Levine, author of How We Love Now, joins us to share her thoughts on tackling the thornier issues of friendships: jealousy, oversights, and holding back on the truth. Be sure to catch this important discussion of when friendships turn toxic.

item.title: Gloria Feldt - Mar 20,2012
item.description:
Gloria Feldt is the best selling author of No Excuses: 9 Ways Women Can Change How We Think About Power. She’s also a tireless champion for women’s rights, a highly sought-after speaker, and a political activist. Gloria will be joining us to share her views on the power and privilege of being a woman over fifty today. Do not miss this very special discussion—it is guaranteed to inspire you!

item.title: Dr. Debra Jaliman - Mar 14,2012
item.description:
Dr. Debra Jaliman, M.D. is a top New York City dermatologist whose clientele includes a number of celebrities and other high profile residents of the Big Apple. Her much anticipated book, Skin Rules: Trade Secrets From a Top New York Dermatologist, has just been released to rave reviews. Dr. Jaliman is joining us to share some of these surprising facts about the best, and often inexpensive, ways to add a youthful glow to your skin. If you’re a woman over 50 who cares about her appearance (and what feisty woman doesn’t?), you’ll want to be sure to catch this information-packed interview!

Dr. Jaliman is joining us to share some of these surprising facts about the best, and often inexpensive, ways to add a youthful glow to your skin. If you’re a woman over 50 who cares about her appearance (and what feisty woman doesn’t?), you’ll want to be sure to catch this information-packed interview!

item.title: Dana White and the Red Suitcase - Mar 09,2012
item.description:
At long last the face of a mature woman will grace the silver screen! Veteran actress Kathleen Chalfant is taking on the role of Ruth—a sixty year-old divorcée whose fictional life mirrors the experience of countless boomer women. Dana White, writer and producer of the film, The Red Suitcase, is joining us to share this remarkable story of a mother and daughter--the layers of their relationship and how a journey together across the U.S. brings about a number of surprising revelations. It’s a riveting tale and one that focuses on life after fifty...a long awaited reflection of the lives of mature women. So be sure to tune in and catch this enlightening look at boomers, our daughters, and the surprises inside a red suitcase!

item.title: Jeanne Safer, Ph.D. and Cain's Legacy - Mar 07,2012
item.description:
Have you ever had difficulties with your sibling(s)? Have you battled over your inheritance and family possessions? Do you share unresolved conflicts and wounds that go way back? If so, you’re not alone! According to Dr. Safer, about a third of sibling relationships are destructive and immersed in conflict. To help the 85 percent of Americans with brothers and/or sisters, Dr. Safer has just published her latest work, Cain’s Legacy, and she’s joining us on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio to tell us all about it. If you’ve ever done battle with a sibling, you know how difficult this can be—so be certain to tune in for Dr. Safer’s important message!

item.title: Dr. Mark Hyman - Feb 28,2012
item.description:
You know Dr. Hyman from his bestselling books and frequent appearances on PBS and the Dr. Oz show. This renowned physician’s message of health and wellbeing is even more important for those of us over 50. Dr. Hyman will share all about his latest work, The Blood Sugar Solution, and the science behind why blood sugar affects your chances for obesity, diabetes, cancer, heart disease, and a myriad of other health concerns. If you want to remain healthy in your later years, you’ll want to be sure to tune in for this very special broadcast!

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine: How We Love Now! - Feb 24,2012
item.description:
Whether youre in a long-term relationship, have recently started dating, or have reconnected with an old flame, the years past 50 bring a richness and depth to romance. Suzanne Braun Levine, author of the recently released, How We Love Now: Sex and the New Intimacy in Second Adulthood, joins us once again to share her thoughts on this important part of our lives. So, no matter what type of relationship you find yourself in, be certain to tune in for this one--theres nothing better than finding and sharing love after 50!

item.description:
January is the month to make positive changes in your life and the #1 resolution for most of us is to lose weight and get fit. Join us as the popular trainer, Coach Nicole of SparkPeople, shares her fat-blasting workouts. Better yet, these results-producing segments are safe and effective for anyone. item.description:

Nicholas Lore, author of The Pathfinder: How to Choose or Change Your Career for a Lifetime of Satisfaction and Success is joining us to give you his "7 Tips for Finding Work You Love." item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine: How We Love Now! - Jan 10,2012
item.description:
Suzanne Braun Levine, former managing editor of Ms. magazine and longtime activist for women’s rights, is now a prolific author and this countrys premier observer of women in Second Adulthood. Her latest book, How We Love Now is about love, sex, and intimacy at this stage in our lives. In addition to the physical, emotional, and psychological shifts we experience during “the change,” our relationships also transform. Suzanne is joining us to share her findings on the ways our personal reinvention affects those around us. So be sure to tune in... you wont want to miss this important and enlightening message!

item.description:
Ever experience the joys and challenges of mothering a teenage daughter? If so, you’ll want to tune into this one! Award-winning author, Natalie Wexler, has just come out with another book that’s certain to become a winner. item.description:
Join this feisty conversation with Suzanne Braun Levine as she shares her thoughts on the fertile void, the power of “no,” and tooting your own horn. (Yes, they’re all related!) Coming off her bravura appearance at TEDx Women, Suzanne will also give us her take on speaking up and speaking out…and the exhilarating ride of pushing past your self-imposed boundaries to conquer new territory. Youll want to be sure to catch this one!

item.title: The Holidays: BEST Time of Year to Look for Work! - Dec 04,2011
item.description:
Join me, Mary Eileen Williams, as I give you the reasons why the holidays are the absolutely BEST time of year to land a job. You know me as a radio host and a blogger at Huffington Post & Feisty Side of Fifty, but Im also a job search specialist and author of Land the Job You Love: 10 Surefire Strategies for Jobseekers Over 50. In addition to a Masters Degree in Career Development, Ive enjoyed a 20+year career working with midlife jobseekers and teaching them the critical skills they need to successfully navigate the job market of today. So tune in and celebrate the season by landing the jobYOU LOVE!

item.title: Jan Reesman - Nov 30,2011
item.description:
Meet producer/director/writer and actress, Jan Reesman. After beginning her career as a theater actress in New York, Jan moved to Los Angeles where she turned to producing and directing plays. Her background, which includes a stint as a Playboy Bunny, is rich with credits—she wrote and directed the award-winning short, “Escaping Jersey,” narrated by Marietta Hartley. Now she’s up to new “bunny business” showing that boomers have still got it. You won’t want to miss this one!

item.title: Susan Sikora: Tales of a Talk Show Host - Nov 16,2011
item.description:
Meet Susan Sikora, Emmy award-winner and 8-time nominee whos interviewed everyone from Caroline Kennedy, to Walter Cronkite, to Dr. Wayne Dyer, to famed lawyer, Alan Dershowitz. A boomer herself, Susan will share memorable moments from her career, how she broke through the broadcast glass ceiling when that wasnt easy to do, and what its like working in a youth-oriented medium. You’ll want to be sure to catch this behind the scenes look at the life of a TV talk show host!

You’ll want to be sure to catch this behind the scenes look at the life of a TV talk show host!

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine: The New Intimacy - Nov 01,2011
item.description:
Our favorite observer of life after fifty, Suzanne Braun Levine, is joining us once again. This time, shell be sharing her thoughts on the "New Intimacy" that can take hold and revitalize our relationships in midlife. But second adulthood and changing priorities can also bring up issues around interdependence and fear. So make sure to tune in for this important discussion on how aging can affect your ties with those you hold dear.

item.title: Intimacy After Cancer - Sep 28,2011
item.description:
If you or your loved one has had a cancer diagnosis, you know this changes your life in countless ways. One of the most delicate may be in the way you share intimate moments with your partner. Join us for an important discussion on this very topic as Patty Brisben, founder of Pure Romance, and Dr. Keri Peterson, M.D. contributor to Women’s Health magazine share their thoughts on living your best life (in and out of the bedroom) after cancer.

item.title: Another Bad Dog Book! - Sep 27,2011
item.description:
Ever feel like youre barking up the wrong tree? If so, youll relate to the author of Another Bad Dog Book. Joni Cole is joining us to share her insights into life, love, and neurotic human behavoir--all from the perspective of a midlife woman with a wicked sense of humor. Her collection of essays will both warm your heart and make you howl at the fun and foibles inherent to growing older. So tune in--you wont wanna miss this one!

item.description:
Do you want more passion and purpose in your life? If so, be sure to join relationship healing expert, Dr. Erica Goodstone, as she shares her process for reinvigorating the bonds you hold with those most dear. A Licensed Mental Health Counselor, columnist, and author of Love Me, Touch Me, Heal Me: The Path to Physical, Emotional, Sexual and Spiritual Relationship, Dr. Erica will cover a full range of healing techniques to overcome the common problems of relationships today. Youll want to be certain to tune in for this one!

item.title: Leslie Kagen - Sep 09,2011
item.description:
Leslie Kagen, bestselling author of Whistling in the Dark, is debuting her much-anticipated sequel, Good Graces. She joins us to share all about this intricately woven tale of the loss of childhood innocence. The story will hit home for boomers as its set in the fifties complete with pop music, soda fountains, and the issues of the day. Youll want to make sure to tune in for this one!

item.title: Your Second Blooming! - Sep 07,2011
item.description:
If youre over 50, youre well aware that the womens movement changed everything. With increased opportunities but few role models for crafting a satisfying midlife, the author of Second Blooming shares her step-by-step process to help you rediscover your talents, strengths, and passions. Be sure to tune in and learn the ways you can create a plan for living your own best life after fifty.

item.description:

This time, she departs from her focus on women over 50 to address whats going on with the men in our lives. item.title: Chloe Jon Paul - Aug 16,2011
item.description:
If youve ever wanted to write a novel, youll want to be certain to hear what Chloe Jon Paul has to say. After 35 years in the classroom, she retired to start writing in earnest. Shes now published three books and has returned to her earlier career with her latest: The Business of Children. Chloe also a long list of additional accomplishments to her name. So tune in--this woman embodies the feisty side of fifty for sure!

item.title: The Latest on Lung Cancer - Aug 04,2011
item.description:
Like many boomers, I smoked for years. If you were a smoker, too, youll want to learn the latest findings on lung cancer, risk factors, prevention, and the importance of screening. Dr. Reginald Munden, professor of diagnostic radiology, joins us to share the latest breakthroughs in early detection. Dont miss this one--youll breath easier when you hear what the doctor has to say!

item.title: Director Alison Ellwood - Jul 27,2011
item.description:
Those of us who remember the sixties have certainly heard of the Merry Pranksters. This ragtag group of free spirits, along with their fearless leader, Ken Kesey, set off from California on a mythical bus ride ending up at the 1964 Worlds Fair in New York. To say the trip was "adventurous" is a massive understatement. These pranksters more than lived up to their name and may have kicked off the rowdier aspects of the psychedelic sixties. Alison Ellwood and Academy Award winner Alex Gibney have directed a film that captured it all. Magic Trip more than lives up to its name and serves up a treasure trove of visual snippets that will make you shout: "far out!" Check out the trailer here and be certain tune in and hear Alisons version of the experience--youll be guaranteed to get your groove on!

item.description:
Hold onto your support hose--this is going to be a good one! The feisty and oh-so-fabulous "Granny" of the Coot Avengers, is back to update us on the groups most recent daring deeds in the fight against ageism. Just like Clark Kent, Kay Wood might appear mild-mannered but wait til she heads for the phone booth (if she can find one these days!) and turns into a super heroine. Granny is definitely on a roll so be certain to tune in for this one!

item.title: Wisdom to Wellness with Maureen Minnehan Jones - Jul 22,2011
item.description:
If youve been suffering from any type of disease, youll want to be certain to listen to this enlightening and uplifting discussion with author/expert Maureen Minnehan Jones. Maureen, a registered nurse, guided imagery instructor, and creator of an exciting wisdom to wellness technique, will share her thoughts on the common threads of dis-ease and how you can heal yourself by tapping into the power of unconditional love. Be sure to tune in for this important and life-enhancing message!

item.title: Cynthia Sass - Jul 14,2011
item.description:
Nutritionist and best selling author, Cynthia Sass, will join us to share her tips on creating a slimmer, trimmer YOU! The woman behind The Flat Belly Diet, Your Diet is Driving Me Crazy and her latest book, Cinch has some feisty and foolproof food suggestions to keep you looking and feeling your best. (One of them is to eat chocolate on a daily basis!) So, if youre looking for a svelte summer body, be certain to tune in for this one!

item.title: Kathi Casey - Jul 01,2011
item.description:
Do you suffer from nagging back pain? Your odds of answering, "yes" to that question are huge as 8 out of 10 Americans experience back pain at some time in their lives. And, as we all know, with age, boomers are especially vulnerable. But we have our "ace in the hole" as Kathi Casey, aka the Healthy Boomer Body Expert, is coming out with a new book that promises relief. Stop Back Pain--Kiss Your Back, Neck and Sciatic Nerve Pain Goodbye! provides non invasive treatment options that work. So, if you want to kiss your own aching back pain goodbye, tune in and find out Kathis top techniques that will have you feeling great in no time!

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine: Thoughts on Body Image - Jun 29,2011
item.description:
Have you been experiencing a certain trepidation about "letting it all hang out" in your summer wardrobe? Are you less than thrilled with your bottom in a bikini? If so, you are definitely not alone! The ever-bodacious author of books on women, aging, and the life lessons we need to learn is joining us to share her thoughts on body image. A tender topic at any age, this issue can be especially hard on us feisty folk. So, if youre battling with your mirror and beating up on your body, tune in and hear what Suzanne has to say!

item.title: Timothy Carroll and Love on the Far Side of Fifty! - Jun 21,2011
item.description:
Ever feel like heading out on a blind date? These often awkward events were difficult enough in your twenties and thirties, but now theyre akin to having teeth pulled...without the anesthetic! However author Timothy Carroll is here to revive your faith in romance with his new book, Dont Ever Give Up on Love. So, if youre a single boomer whos looking to find that certain someone, youll want to be sure to catch this one!

item.description:
Can you ask for and get what you want? Maybe not. Negotiating with firmness and finesse--and making your points under pressure--is an ability many women claim we lack. Professional mediator and expert negotiator, Victoria Pynchon, will share the tools you can use to express your needs with confidence. Be certain to catch this one--it just might change your life!

item.description:
Are you dreading "letting it all hang out" this summer? Is your midlife muffin-top puffing up while your hips make their presence known in even more ample ways? If you can answer "yes" to either of these questions (and, at our age, who cant?) youll want to be certain to catch what Kim Barnouin has to say. The co-author of the bestselling Skinny Bitch series, Kim will share her tips on eating foods that guarantee to turn on your fat-fighting forces. Tune in and you just might be donning that super-sveldt swimsuite this summer!

item.title: Dr. Jeffrey Applebaum - Jun 10,2011
item.description:
As baby boomers concerned about out health, we need to know the facts about Alzheimers disease. Join me for an interview with Dr. Jeffrey Applebaum, Assistant Clinical Professor at the University of California at Davis. Dr. Applebaum will share the latest findings from the 2011 Alzheimers Association report, available treatment options, and tips for caring for loved ones with the disease. Be sure to catch this important discussion.

item.title: Essential Skills for Midlife Jobseekers Part IX - Jun 09,2011
item.description:
Join me for a weekly series on the critical skills youll need to know to compete successfully as a jobseekerin midlife. My special guest, Doug Hughes, will share the methods he used to land a new position after being laid offfrom a company where he’d worked for twenty years. The job market has changed substantially and youll be left behind if you dont know the rules of the game today. So tune in and give yourself a boost with the latest strategies that are guaranteed to help YOU achieve success. Also dont forget to check out Land the Job You Love: 10 Surefire Strategies for Jobseekers Over 50. Its the book/workbook that walks you through every step of the process and shows you the way to shave weeks (maybe even months) off your job search. Why not let the next success story be your own? Check me out on TV here!

item.title: Peggy Fleming - Jun 02,2011
item.description:
Peggy Fleming, Olympic Gold Medal winner at the 1968 Olympics in Grenoble, France, is one of our generations shining stars. Shes been a featured performer, media darling, and sports commentator for years as well as a spokesperson for various health related causes. Join us as Peggy shares her tips for staying fit after fifty and tells us all about the National Senior Games taking place this summer in Houston, TX.

item.title: Margery Stein - May 20,2011
item.description:
Tired of putting valuable time and money into working out at a gym and only seeing limited results? Margery is here to tell us how we can get in shape with some hand weights, a mat, and a good exercise DVD. A columnist at NYCitywoman.com, Margery will share what she learned by researching her latest article, "Home Ex: Working Out With the Pros." If youre into fitness, youll want to be certain to catch this one!

item.title: Rae Meadows - May 16,2011
item.description:
Author Rae Meadows is joining us to share the story of her spellbinding new novel, Mothers and Daughters. The book tells of three generations of women--bound together through the multi-layered, complex relationship that only takes place between mothers and their daughters. You wont want to miss this fascinating take on the emotionally rich topic each of us can relate to.

item.title: A Conversation With Suzanne Braun Levine - May 15,2011
item.description:
Best-selling author and founding editor of Ms. Magazine, Suzanne Braun Levine, is joining us for another lively discussion on the rich and multi-layered aspects of life after fifty. This time, Suzanne and I will share our thoughts on reinventing the long-term relationship. From power shifts to fluctuating libidos, midlife means change. So, if youve been in a decades long marriage or other significant coupling, youll want to be certain to catch this one!

item.title: Barbara Rose Brooker - May 14,2011
item.description:
Interview with Barbara Rose Brooker, founder of the Age March, bestselling author, and frequent guest on radio and TV. Barbara will be sharing her news about the upcoming Age March on May 21st in Los Angelesand why we should go after our dreams at any age. As she puts it, “Age has no boundaries and to hide your age is to hide yourself.” Barbara is a lively guest with a spirited point of view--so do yourself a big favor and be certain to catch this one!

item.title: Christine Schwab - May 10,2011
item.description:
As one of the foremost fashion and beauty reporters on TV, Christine Schwab lived a glamorous life. She attended the hottest awards ceremonies, met U.S. presidents, and was featured in popular womens magazines and on such major programs as The Today Show, Oprah, and Entertainment Tonight. But Christine was hiding a secret--one she reveals in her new book, Take Me Home From the Oscars: Arthritis, Television, Fashion, and Me. Be sure to join us for an unforgettable interview about this inspiring, Hollywood tell-all book.

item.title: Louise Knight - May 09,2011
item.description:
Even though I like to say boomers are "reinventing the spirit and style of aging," some of our notable foremothers felt the same way we do now. One remarkable woman, Jane Addams, wrote an essay on aging entitled "Need a Woman Over Fifty Feel Old?" Published in October of 1914, Ms. Addams used the piece to express the same sentiments felt by many of us today. Ms. Addams was a revolutionary trendsetter and age did not slow her down in the slightest. So tune in, learn all about her and her fascinating life from Louise Knight, author of Jane Addams: Spirit in Action. This remarkable woman truly did celebrate the feisty side of fifty!

item.title: Marc Freedman - May 06,2011
item.description:
Midlife means change and Marc Freedman, author, boomer expert, and CEO of Civic Ventures, knows all about it. His latest book, The Big Shift: Navigating the New Stage Beyond Midlife, is a call to redraw the map of life and what we typically know as retirement. Marc challenges us to move into our 60s with a sense of purpose, contribution, and commitment. Learn how you can renew your own passion for work as you help solve our nations most pressing social problems!

item.title: Your Write to Heal - May 04,2011
item.description:
If youre over 50, youve confronted many of lifes hardships. Lynda Aron, author and educator, is joining us to share the power of words--your words--to heal, inspire, and comfort you through difficult times. Writing your thoughts connects your conscious and unconscious minds. This simple act helps to bring up suppressed fears and facilitate healing. Be sure to listen to this powerful lesson and learn to use your own creative energy to dissolve emotional stress and release fear.

item.title: Tina Sloan - Apr 21,2011
item.description:
Youll remember Tina Sloan from "Guiding Light," "Search From Tomorrow," and "Another World." The actress and author will be joining us to tell us all about her changing roles--on screen and off. Her new book "Changing Shoes: Getting Older-Not Old--With Style, Humor, and Grace" has just been released and Tina will share her insightful and humorous look at the aging process with us. Make certain to tune in for this one--it promises to be a fun and lively discussion of growing older like a soap star!

Best-selling author and founding editor of Ms. Magazine, Suzanne Braun Levine, will be joining us for another lively discussion. Now is the perfect time to spring forward in your own life--so be sure to join us and get ready to tear down the self-imposed boundaries that have been stopping you!

You wont want to miss this one!

item.title: Christina Haag - Apr 12,2011
item.description:
Many of us look back fondly on our first romantic experiences, but Christina Haags memories are especially poignant. After all, her first love was none other than John F. Kennedy Jr. and their friendship lasted for more than fifteen years. Be sure to join us for this insider look at the Kennedy family and hear all about Christinas new book, Come to the Edge. Its a touching tribute--rich with insight and tenderness for this remarkable man we lost all too soon.

item.title: Debbie Macomber - Apr 07,2011
item.description:
The #1 New York Times bestselling author, Debbie Macomber visits Feisty Side of Fifty to share her latest work: ONE SIMPLE ACT: Discovering the Power of Generosity. Although Debbie has 130 million books in print, she's switching gears and moving from romance to nonfiction in this inspiring account of how meaningful one simple act can be. You won't want to miss this lively and uplifting discussion with one of the nation's premier authors!

item.title: Susan Polis Schutz - Apr 01,2011
item.description:
Are you enjoying the many great things about being over 50? If so, you'll want to make certain to catch this lively interview with best-selling author and documentary filmmaker, Susan Polis Schutz. Susan will be sharing all about her latest film: OVER 90 AND LOVING IT which is airing nationwide on PBS. You'll learn the secrets of living a fuller, richer life from the feisty 90+ stars of this remarkable film. So be certain to tune in for this one--the best truly is yet to come!

item.title: Nava Atlas on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Mar 30,2011
item.description:
Looking for stories about remarkable women and how they overcame struggles with self-confidence, criticism, the double-standard, and the road to success? If so, have I got a book for you! Nava Atlas, author and artist, has hit another home run with her latest book, "The Literary Ladies." Whether or not you're a budding author yourself, you'll connect with the self-doubts and issues these amazing women faced. And, being the generation who mounted the Women's Movement, you'll also connect with their courage and strength. Join us for a fascinating and uplifting journey into the world of literary ladies of the past. If you've experienced your own struggles (and who hasn't), you won't want to miss this special broadcast!

item.description:
The feisty and fun author of "WHAT TO WEAR FOR THE REST OF YOUR LIFE: Ageless Secrets of Style" is joining us once again. item.title: Barbara Hannah Grufferman on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Mar 18,2011
item.description:
Barbara Hannah Grufferman, author of "The Best of Everything After 50: The Experts' Guide to Style, Sex, Health, Money, and More" is on a mission. She's spreading the word that, yes, we boomers can still have it all. As a weekly blogger for the Huffington Post, Barbara motivates and inspires us to reach for our dreams. But what if you're past 50 and feeling invisible? If so, this is just the show for YOU--Barbara will share her take on "the invisibility factor" and what you can do about it. Don't miss this one!

item.title: Rhonda Anderson on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Mar 16,2011
item.description:
Boomer women have lived rich, full lives and want to share our treasured memories with those we love. Rhoda Anderson came up with the perfect way to preserve these special times in our lives and started a thriving business that does just that. "Creative Memories" is now a worldwide organization who's mission is to help people "remember, celebrate, and connect." Rhonda will share her story of starting with an innovative idea and following her inspiration to achieve her dreams. She's also big on encouraging other women to honor their unique vision. So, if you have a dream of your own, make certain you listen to this one!

item.title: Gloria Feldt & Terry Nagel on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Mar 15,2011
item.description:
In celebration of Women's History month, let's pool our power and create some new and revolutionary history! There's no better way to have our voices heard than by joining forces, entering the political arena, and driving through real and meaningful change. Gloria Feldt, nationally known activist and author of "No Excuses: 9 Ways Women Can Change How We Think About Power" and Terry Nagel, candidate for county supervisor will share their perspectives on politics, equalizing gender power, and the courage to speak up for your beliefs. Be certain to catch this important and inspiring discussion. After all, gender equality and a parity of power is likely the greatest cause of our generation.

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Mar 05,2011
item.description:
International Women's History Day is March 8th. Here to celebrate this special event is the champion for women's rights and founding editor of Ms. magazine, Suzanne Braun Levine. A frequent guest, Suzanne always shares her insights into ways we can live our best lives. This show, she'll present her thoughts on how we can make our voices heard on a larger scale and continue our generation's mission to promote a parity of rights for all the world's citizens. You won't want to miss this very special broadcast!

item.title: Brenda Chapman on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Mar 03,2011
item.description:
Phony food never looked so tasty! Even Rachel Ray agrees and that's how Brenda Chapman made it onto her show. Brenda started "Just Dough It" out of her garage fashioning delicious looking (although fake) pies and selling them at local crafts fairs. Her bogus delicacies soon took off and Brenda's wares are now in great demand by advertisers, TV shows, and the like. She'll be sharing her entrepreneurial story as well as tips on how YOU can start your own successful business. If you're thinking of going after your dreams, don't miss this one!

item.title: Kathi Casey on Blog Talk Radio - Mar 01,2011
item.description:
Join Kathi Casey, aka the "Healthy Boomer Body Expert" who'll be sharing vital information on how you can get relief from your aching back. 70 - 85% of Americans suffer from back pain and the majority of these numbers refer to us boomers. So why suffer when you can get real relief? Tune in and find out you can start to live a life free from back pain. If you've ever endured this debilitating condition, you're not going to want to miss this one!

item.description:
You may not recognize her name, but you'll certainly know her clients: Jennifer Lopez & Julia Roberts are just a couple on her list. Nancy Kennedy is one of Hollywood's premier health and diet experts and she'll be giving us her tips on incorporating exciting flavors into delicious, easy to prepare, and healthy meals. Her new book: "THE HOLLYWOOD WRAP: 100 Quick and Easy Meals to Fuel Your Workout and Help You Lose Weight" is available just in time for the Academy Awards. You won't want to miss a single word this sought-after expert has to share!

item.title: Allen Klein on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 22,2011
item.description:
Author Allen Klein knows the value of a good laugh. The humor he shared with his wife was the one bright spot that got him through the darkest period of his life: her death at 34 from a rare liver disease. Wanting to help others through their own journey of loss and grief, Allen wrote "Learning to Laugh When You Feel Like Crying: Embracing Life After Loss." He'll be telling us how humor is a powerful coping skill and how you can use it to transform your own life for the better.

item.title: Grace Becker on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 18,2011
item.description:
Have you ever wanted to start your own home business and, better yet, have it be successful? If so, this the show for you! Grace Becker, founder of Becker's Dozen, is a mom, volunteer, and an entrepreneur with a heart. She'll tell you how she created her premier catering service--delivering the highest quality backed goods--and she'll show you how you can get started yourself through her new program "Dough Rising Mom." If you've ever wanted to work from home, make a profit, and help others, be certain to catch this one!

item.title: Barbara Lovenheim on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 17,2011
item.description:
If you're looking for an online magazine for smart, stylish women on the "right side of forty" who are eager to embrace the challenges and opportunities of this age, be sure to catch this interview. Barbara Lovenheim, has a long and illustrious history in journalism and publishing. Now, she's turning her considerable talents to her latest job as Founding Editor of NYCityWoman. Not restricted to the ladies of the Big Apple, this new magazine is a fabulous resource for boomers throughout the land. It addresses career, healthcare, lifestyle choices and more: all the issues we deal with on the feisty side of fifty. So be sure to tune in and hear Barbara tell us all about it!

item.title: Vivian Diller, author of FACE IT on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 15,2011
item.description:
Ever looked in the mirror and pondered your wrinkles, sagging jawline, or droopy eyelids? If so, you're not alone! Women over 50 are definitely feisty but we still have to contend with our changing faces and bodies. Here to unravel the often complicated, multi-faceted feelings we have about aging is former model and dancer turned Ph.D Psychologist and author of FACE IT, Vivian Diller. If you're a woman in midlife, you'll want to be certain to catch this fascinating and uplifting look at aging.

item.title: Meet Coot Avenger "Granny" on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 10,2011
item.description:
Do you get tired of our youth-worshiping culture and wish you could set those young whippersnappers straight? Well, much the same way Superman swooped down from the sky to take on the bad guys, the Coot Avengers are on a mission to reverse those nasty stereotypes about us folks over fifty. Using humor as their weapon of choice, they're putting pen to paper and creating wryly humorous cartoons with a punch. So get ready for one feisty interview--you won't want to miss this one!

item.title: Red Hat Society's Exalted Queen Mother on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 09,2011
item.description:
Every woman over 50 longs do don a bright red hat, a purple dress, and hoot and holler with her friends. This mixture of fashion and fun is all thanks Sue Ellen Cooper, the Exalted Queen Mother of the special club that truly celebrates the years past fifty. Sue Ellen and Red Hat Society CEO, Debra Granich, are joining us to share some very special news. So grab your feather boa and get ready for a broadcast that will leave you glad you're a woman of a certain age. Our hats are off to the Red Hat Society and making the feisty side of fifty so much fun!

item.title: 6 Keys to a Winning Interview - Feb 07,2011
item.description:
Tired of being overlooked just because you're past 50? Feeling frustrated by the lack of opportunities you're finding? Don't want to be labeled as "over the hill" when you're in your prime? If you find yourself saying "yes" to these questions, this show is for YOU! Tune in and find out how you can make yourself more attractive as a seasoned candidate and ace the job interview--even if you haven't interviewed in years. If you or boomer friend are looking for work, you won't want to miss this one!

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 05,2011
item.description:
The former editor of Ms. magazine and author of numerous bestselling books for women in midlife is joining us once again to share her insights into aging and how we boomers are doing it with style. item.title: Sigrid Olsen on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Feb 02,2011
item.description:
Wearing an outfit designed by Sigrid Olsen is like walking through a meadow in spring. The colorful, animated print enlivens your senses and puts a bounce in your step. Now that she's no longer in the apparel business, Sigrid (a boomer over fifty) has transformed her life and is using her boundless creativity to design ceramics, stationary, prints, and other artwork. She's even leading what she calls "Inspiration Retreats" where she guides participants to unleash their own creative juices. Be certain to tune in and find out the latest about this remarkable artist of our generation. It promises to be a lively discussion you won't want to miss!

item.title: Boomers and Ageism: The Real Truth Part II - Jan 31,2011
item.description:
Tired of being overlooked just because you're past 50? Feeling frustrated by the lack of opportunities you're finding? Don't want to be labeled as "over the hill" when you're in your prime? If you find yourself saying "yes" to these questions, this show is for YOU! Tune in and find out the real truth behind ageism, what you can do about it, and all the strengths you bring as a seasoned applicant. As a baby boomer, you're a member of the mightiest generation of them all. it's time to take back your power!

item.title: Beverly Mahone on Feisty side of fifty - Jan 25,2011
item.description:
Beverly Mahone, author of "Don't Ask and I Won't Have to Lie: 50 is the New 30 and Other Tall Tales" will be here to spill the truth about lying. Have you ever fibbed about your age or weight, or do you find yourself sparing your friends' feelings with little white lies? If so, you gotta tune in for this lively discussion on why we tell our own tall tales--it'll be a whopper of a show for sure!

item.title: Susan Hall on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Jan 18,2011
item.description:
Interview with author and artist, Susan Hall. Susan is a highly regarded painter who has received two National Endowment for the Arts awards. Her work has been exhibited at the Whitney Museum of Art, the San Francisco Museum of Art (both solo exhibitions), the national Museum of Women in the Arts and many other venues. Susan will be telling us about her latest work, a beautifully written and illustrated book, RIVER FLOWING HOME, about her personal journey back to herself and her "bedrock." You won't want to miss this insightful and inspiring interview.

item.description:
How does the growing digital revolution impact our thoughts on culture, politics, and religion? Join my guest, Rev. Susan Thistlethwaite, author of DREAMING OF EDEN: AMERICAN RELIGION AND POLITICS IN A WIRED WORLD, for a lively and thought-provoking discussion on how access to rapid-fire information affects our decisions on the complex matters we face today.

item.title: Steve Boettcher, producer/director PBS series Pioneers of Television - Jan 10,2011
item.description:
As the first TV generation, we boomers hold great fondness for our favorite series from the 50s and 60s. PBS is once again feeding our need for nostalgia with the second go-round of Pioneers of Television. Be sure to join us for stories about James Garner, William Shatner, Stefanie Powers and many other favorite stars. This one will be a true blast from the past!

item.title: Jaki Scarcello on Feisty side of Fifty Radio - Dec 15,2010
item.description:
"Fifty & Fabulous" author Jaki Scarcello shares her thoughts on reaping the fruits of a life well lived, recognizing and receiving the real gifts that fifty-plus brings, and knowing that being over fifty means more not less. As Jaki puts it: "our attitudes toward aging can bring about a 'virtuous cycle' of rejuvenation." Be sure to tune in to celebrate your own blossoming elegance and the ripeness of your potential on the fabulous side of fifty!

item.title: Barbara Rose Brooker - Nov 08,2010
item.description:
Interview with Barbara Rose Brooker, author of the bestseller, "The Diaries," founder of the Age March, and frequent guest on radio and TV. Barbara will share her thoughts on just going for it at any age and, true to her words, she's thriving in her seventies. As she puts it, "Age has no boundaries and to hide your age is to hide yourself." Right on, Barbara!

item.description:
Interview with Chris Moon-Willems, life coach specializing in the issues and concerns of women in midlife. She'll be telling us all about her upcoming teleseminar, Talking Prime Time Women, beginning on Nov. 8th. Chris has gathered an impressive international panel of highly regarded experts in their fields who will share their ideas for living fully after fifty. item.title: Betsy Werley on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Oct 27,2010
item.description:
Interview with Betsy Werley, Executive Director of The Transition Network. Betsy is making her second appearance on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio. This time she'll be sharing her personal and professional experience and her thoughts on transitioning to a career in nonprofit work. Women in midlife, especially, are finding new meaning and rewarding challenges in the not-for-profit sector so you'll want to be sure and catch this one. Who knows, you just might find your life's purpose on the feisty side of fifty!

item.title: Dr. Srinivasan Pillay on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Sep 03,2010
item.description:
Interview with Srinivasan Pillay, M.D. and author of LIFE UNLOCKED: 7 Revolutionary Lessons to Overcome Fear. Dr. Pillay is both a brain imaging researcher and a master coach. He'll be giving us an overview of how our brains work (in plain English!) and how we can free ourselves from the fears that hold us back from achieving what we truly want. This is a not-to-be-missed interview that will leave you with lots of food for thought!

item.description:
Interview with Kim Johnson Gross, author of "What to Wear for the Rest of Your Life." item.title: Diana Raab on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Aug 26,2010
item.description:
Interview with Diana Raab, author of Healing With Words: A Writer's Cancer Journey. Diana, who is a nurse, author, and mother of three, shares her beautifully written and inspiring story of how penning her thoughts helped her cope with the life-altering diagnosis of cancer. She shares her reflections on the experience through journal entries, poetry, and writing prompts for her readers to express their own journey. Don't miss this thoughtful and uplifting interview on the power of the written word!

item.title: Betsy Werley on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Aug 10,2010
item.description:
Interview with Betsy Werley, Executive Director of The Transition Network. Betsy will share the mission and values of this inspiring and powerful collective of women over 50. The group is open to any of us over 50 and supports members through the various life issues we face as we age. The Transition Network offers new perspectives and opportunities as well as the strength of the collective voices of engaged and energetic women. Be sure to catch this one and find out all about this amazing organization!

item.title: Laurie Fabiano Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Jul 27,2010
item.description:
Interview with Laurie Fabiano, author of "Elizabeth Street." This debut novel is a true labor of love as it tells the fascinating story of the Italian immigrant experience-- much of it drawn from the author's own family. Fabiano spent ten years researching her family's history and weaving their struggles into the larger historical implications of the times. She'll be sharing her fascinating findings with us.

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Jul 19,2010
item.description:
Interview with Suzanne Braun Levine, founding editor of Ms. magazine and author of several books on woman and aging. Suzanne is joining us for an exciting 10-part series about her latest book, "Fifty is the New Fifty: Ten Life Lessons for Women in Second Adulthood." In this final installment, Suzanne tells us why "Fifty is the New Fifty" and how midlife women of today are "recalibrating our place in the world." It's an exciting time to be growing older as we boomers are revolutionizing the spirit and style of aging. Be certain to catch all 10 of these amazing insights and life lessons. You'll come away with a renewed sense of self-determination, purpose, and energy as you learn how fifty truly is the NEW fifty!

item.description:
Interview with Anne Holmes, "Boomer in Chief" of the National Association of Baby Boomer Women. A true champion of boomer women, Anne is continuing to spread the word of our generation's feisty and trailblazing ways through her numerous websites. She's got a ton of ideas and lots of energy, so be sure and tune in to hear how she plans to grow the NABBW and her other sites-- making them even more exciting and valuable resources for baby boomer women!

item.description:
Interview with Suzanne Braun Levine, founding editor of Ms. magazine and author of several books on woman and aging. Suzanne is joining us for an exciting 10-part series about her latest book, "Fifty is the New Fifty: Ten Life Lessons for Women in Second Adulthood." item.title: Sally Franz on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Jun 22,2010
item.description:
Interview with Sally Franz, award winning, best selling author of boomer humor. She'll be filling us in on her latest book: SCRAMBLED LEGS...A SNARKY TALE OF HOSPITAL HOOEY. With her signature wit, Sally lampoons the health care system and shares her own (often not-so-funny) experiences with optimism and style. Her fans include Dave Barry, Mark Victor Hansen, Jonathan Winters, and Jane Meadows. This is a can't miss interview!

item.title: Suzanne Braun Levine on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Jun 21,2010
item.description:
Interview with Suzanne Braun Levine, founding editor of Ms. magazine and author of several books on woman and aging. Suzanne is joining us for an exciting 10-part series about her latest book, "Fifty is the New Fifty: Ten Life Lessons for Women in Second Adulthood." In this installment, Suzanne tells us: "Yes, your marriage can make it!" She'll be discussing how midlife can actually strengthen the couple bond. Even though we're seeking to redefine ourselves, there can be numerous positive aspect to be found in this very special relationship.

item.title: Lisa Beatty on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - May 25,2010
item.description:
Interview with Lisa Beatty, founder of the fabulous website "Jane Nation." Lisa will be telling us how she came up with the idea for her site as well as some interesting facts she learned from her 12-day "Listening Tour" where she interacted with women 18-80. Hear what she learned about being a grandmother today and the #1 disease women fear most. Be sure and tune in for this lively discussion of being a woman in the twenty-first century!

item.description:
Interview with Barbara Graham, editor of the New York Times bestseller, "Eye of My Heart." Find out how 27 writers deal with the joys and challenges of being a grandmother in today's fast-paced world. Boomers are reinventing the role as we've reinvented so many aspects of society. So be sure and catch these heartfelt stories of the strong and special bonds between women and their grandchildren.

item.title: Jon Biondi on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Dec 01,2009
item.description:
Dec. 1 is World AIDS Day. Approximately 1.5 million children in Malawi, Africa have been orphaned by losing their parents to AIDS. Interview with Jon Biondi, founder of the non profit, Youth of Malawi. He'll be telling us about how his organization seeks to brighten the lives of these orphans by providing fun recreational activities and other services to help them move forward with their lives.

item.title: Jane Adams on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Nov 10,2009
item.description:
Interview with Jane Adams, Ph.D, author, speaker, and social researcher. Jane will tell us all about her latest book, SUGAR TIME. It's the story of a women, "somewhere between her first issue of Modern Maturity and her first Social Security check," and her issues with love, work, sex, and lots of other things we deal with in real life. Don't miss this lively discussion of a story you'll not only relate to, but one you'll love.

item.description:
Interview with Peggy Kennedy, marketing manager for the hugely successful San Francisco Chinese New Year's Parade. Peggy shares the story of her remarkable family in her recently released memoir, "Approaching Neverland." item.title: Robert Lipsyte on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Sep 16,2009
item.description:
Interview with Robert Lipsyte, Emmy award winner and former New York Times columnist, who hosts the PBS series, "Life (Part 2)." Focusing on all things boomer, Lipsyte explores topics ranging from marriage, to healthy aging, to the science of happiness. His guests include Martha Stewart, Mike Huckabee, Billie Jean King, Phil Donahue, David Hyde Pierce, and Joy Behar. Be sure and catch this lively discussion of our remarkable generation and how we're growing older in revolutionary style!

item.title: Peggy Kennedy on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Apr 28,2009
item.description:
Interview with Peggy Kennedy, marketing manager for the hugely successful San Francisco Chinese New Year's Parade. Peggy shares the story of her remarkable family and her recently released memoir: a touching account of triumph over tragedy. Be sure to tune in and be inspired!

item.title: Nava Atlas on Feisty Side of Fifty Radio - Apr 16,2009
item.description:
Interview with Nava Atlas, artist and author. She'll discuss her latest book, "Secret Recipes for the Modern Wife," a tongue-in-cheek treasure trove of marital gems.
